intro: Heteropterys floridana, commonly known as the Florida holly or Florida waxleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white, five-petaled flowers. It produces small, round, red fruits that contain seeds. Heteropterys floridana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
